SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.ui

Interface UserInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
GraphicalUserInterface, TextualUserInterface
public interface UserInterface
Interface that allows to define User Interfaces to present the game data to the player and to process the player's input.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    reportError(RuntimeException exception)
    Allows to report an error to the user through the user interface
    void
    resetError()
    Allows to reset previously reported errors
    void
    setChatScene(Player player)
    Sets the interface that displays the chat where the user can send and receive message from other players (and from the server).
    void
    setConnectionScene()
    Sets the interface that allows the user to connect to the server by specifying the IP, the port and the protocol.
    void
    setCreateGameScene()
    Sets the interface that allows the user to create a game by providing their nickname (gameID) and the number of expected players
    void
    setDrawScene()
    Sets the interface that allows the user to pick up one of the available cards
    void
    setGameStatus(GameStatus gameStatus, TurnStatus turnStatus, String playerTurn)
    Allows to provide the current game status data to the User interface
    void

    Sets the interface that allows the user to join a game by selecting one of the available games and by providing a nickname

    Sets the interface that represents the main scene of the game.

    Sets the interface that allows the user to place the starting card
    void
    setPlayerBoardScene(Player player)
    Sets the interface that displays the provided player's board.
    void
    setRuleScene()
    Sets the interface that allows the user to read the game rules.

    Sets the interface that displays the scoreboard

    Sets the interface that allows the user to select the private goal

    update()

  • Method Details

    • setConnectionScene

      void setConnectionScene()
      Sets the interface that allows the user to connect to the server by specifying the IP, the port and the protocol.

    • setMainScene

      void setMainScene()
      Sets the interface that represents the main scene of the game.

    • setCreateGameScene

      void setCreateGameScene()
      Sets the interface that allows the user to create a game by providing their nickname (gameID) and the number of expected players

    • setJoinGameScene

      void setJoinGameScene()
      Sets the interface that allows the user to join a game by selecting one of the available games and by providing a nickname

    • setWaitPlayersScene

      void setWaitPlayersScene()
      Sets the interface that represents the game Lobby. The player can select their color and see the list of connected players

    • setPlaceStartScene

      void setPlaceStartScene()
      Sets the interface that allows the user to place the starting card

    • setSelectGoalScene

      void setSelectGoalScene()
      Sets the interface that allows the user to select the private goal

    • setDrawScene

      void setDrawScene()
      Sets the interface that allows the user to pick up one of the available cards

    • setPlayerBoardScene

      void setPlayerBoardScene(Player player)
      Sets the interface that displays the provided player's board.
      Parameters:
      player - Player whose board needs to be displayed.

    • setChatScene

      void setChatScene(Player player)
      Sets the interface that displays the chat where the user can send and receive message from other players (and from the server).
      Parameters:
      player - Player whose chat with the local player needs to be displayed, null to display the public chat

    • setScoreScene

      void setScoreScene()
      Sets the interface that displays the scoreboard

    • setRuleScene

      void setRuleScene()
      Sets the interface that allows the user to read the game rules.

    • update

      void update()
      Allows to update the displayed content on the user interface

    • reportError

      void reportError(RuntimeException exception)
      Allows to report an error to the user through the user interface
      Parameters:
      exception - RuntimeException that carries the error data

    • resetError

      void resetError()
      Allows to reset previously reported errors

    • setGameStatus

      void setGameStatus(GameStatus gameStatus, TurnStatus turnStatus, String playerTurn)
      Allows to provide the current game status data to the User interface
      Parameters:
      gameStatus - current GameStatus phase
      turnStatus - current TurnStatus (PLACE/DRAW)
      playerTurn - the nickname of the player that needs to play
